short-title.#text: Savings, Accountability, Value, and Efficiency II Act

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the
The table of contents of this Act is as follows:

toc-entry.#text: Sec. 1. Short title; table of contents.
Sec. 2. Department of Defense unmanned aircraft systems.
Sec. 3. Finalizing Department of Defense inventory management guidance.
Sec. 4. Revocation or denial of passport and passport card in case of certain unpaid taxes.
Sec. 5. Consideration of prospective antidumping and countervailing duty collection system.
Sec. 6. Report on effectiveness of foreign assistance programs and projects.
Sec. 7. Conversion of prison X-ray systems.
Sec. 8. Prohibition on non-cost effective minting and printing of coins and currency.
Sec. 9. Restrictions on printing and distribution of paper copies of Congressional documents.

text.#text: The

header.#text: Finalizing Department of Defense inventory management guidance

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall issue revised inventory management guidance that—

text.#text: As part of the implementation of the Department of Defense Comprehensive Inventory Management Improvement Plan, the

header.#text: Department of defense inventory management guidance

text.#text: strengthens demand forecasting, visibility of on-hand inventory, reviews of on-order excess inventory, and management of inventory held for economic and contingency reasons in order to prevent on-order and on-hand excess inventory;

establishes a comprehensive, standardized set of department-wide supply chain and inventory management metrics, including standardized definitions, to measure five key attributes (materiel readiness, responsiveness, reliability, cost, and planning and precision) of supply chain management operations; and
establishes procedures for measuring and reporting these metrics on a regular basis to ensure the effectiveness and cost-efficiency of supply chain and inventory management operations.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall complete the revision of inventory management guidance required by
and submit the revised guidance to
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Savings, Accountability, Value, and Efficiency II Act/s:3/ss:a

header.#text: Consideration of prospective antidumping and countervailing duty collection system

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall submit to

a report containing an evaluation of the merits and feasibility of converting from a retrospective antidumping and countervailing duty collection system to a prospective antidumping and countervailing duty collection system. If the
recommends conversion to a particular prospective system, the
shall include in the report an estimate of the costs to be incurred and cost savings to be achieved as a result of converting to such prospective system.

text.#text: Not later than 180 days after the date of the enactment of this Act, the

header.#text: Report on effectiveness of foreign assistance programs and projects

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall submit to
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Inspector General of the United States Agency for International Development

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: a report on the effectiveness of each foreign assistance program and project of the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: United States Agency for International Development

text.#text: Not later than one year after the date of the enactment of this Act, the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall, with respect to each such program and project, include a description of the following:
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Savings, Accountability, Value, and Efficiency II Act/s:6/ss:a

text.#text: The report required by
How funds and other resources provided to a foreign entity under the program or project are spent or used.
The extent to which such funds and other resources are spent or used in accordance with the purposes of the program or project.
The extent to which such funds and other resources assist in achieving the results intended for the program or project.

The extent to which there is a correlation between the program or project and a change in the policies or popular attitudes towards the United States in the foreign country in which the program or project is carried out.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , in order to reduce the cost and improve the efficacy of Federal prison health care, shall, to the extent practicable and cost effective, convert by 2015 all X-ray systems in Federal prisons from analog, film-based systems to digital, filmless systems.

text.#text: The

header.#text: Prohibition on non-cost effective minting and printing of coins and currency

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , is amended by adding at the end the following:
may not mint or issue any coin that costs more to produce than the denomination of the coin (including labor, materials, dies, use of machinery, overhead expenses, marketing, and shipping).

text.#text: Notwithstanding any other provision of this subchapter, the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , is amended by adding at the end the following:

may not engrave or print any United States currency that costs more to produce than the denomination of the currency (including labor, materials, dies, use of machinery, overhead expenses, marketing, and shipping).

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: or

text.#text: If any rule or regulation of the

header.#text: Exercise of rulemaking authority of Senate and House

text.#text: This subsection is enacted by

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: and
, respectively, and as such it is deemed a part of the rules of each House, respectively, and it supersedes other rules only to the extent that it is inconsistent with such rules; and

text.#text: as an exercise of the rulemaking power of the

with full recognition of the constitutional right of either House to change the rules (so far as relating to the procedure of that House) at any time, in the same manner, and to the same extent as in the case of any other rule of that House.
This section and the amendments made by this section shall apply with respect to documents produced on or after January 1, 2015.
